monster.name: Animated Table
monster.type: construct, Tales from the Yawning Portal
monster.conditionImmune: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Tales from the Yawning Portal, page 230

trait.name: Constructed Nature
trait.text: An animated table doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
trait.text: The table is incapacitated while in the area of an antimagic field. If targeted by dispel magic, the table must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall unconscious for 1 minute.

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: While the table remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal table.

trait.name: Charge
trait.text: If the table moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 (2d8) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

action.name: Ram
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

monster.name: Centaur Mummy
monster.type: undead, Tales from the Yawning Portal
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Tales from the Yawning Portal, page 231

trait.name: Undead Nature
trait.text: A mummy doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Charge
trait.text: If the centaur mummy moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a pike attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 10 (3d6) piercing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The centaur mummy makes two melee attacks, one with its pike and one with its hooves, or it attacks with its pike and uses Dreadful Glare.

action.name: Pike
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) piercing damage.

action.name: Hooves
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with mummy rot. The cursed target can't regain hit points, and its hit point maximum decreases by 10 (3d6) for every 24 hours that elapse. If the curse reduces the target's hit point maximum to 0, the target dies, and its body turns to dust. The curse lasts until removed by the remove curse spell or similar magic.

action.name: Dreadful Glare
action.text: The centaur mummy targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. If the target can see the mummy, the target must succeed on a DC 12 wisdom saving throw against this magic or become frightened until the end of the mummy's next turn. If the target fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it is also paralyzed for the same duration. A target that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to the Dreadful Glare of all mummies (but not mummy lords) for tne next 24 hours.

monster.name: Deathlock Wight
monster.type: undead, Tales from the Yawning Portal
monster.resist: necrotic; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
monster.languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Tales from the Yawning Portal, page 233

trait.name: Undead Nature
trait.text: A wight doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The wight's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 13). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no verbal or material components:
At will: detect magic, disguise self, mage armor
1/day each:fear, hold person, misty step

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the wight has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The wight attacks twice with Grave Bolt.

action.name: Grave Bolt
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) necrotic damage.

action.name: Life Drain
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

A humanoid slain by this attack rises 24 hours later as a zombie under the wight's control, unless the humanoid is restored to life or its body is destroyed. The wight can have no more than twelve zombies under its control at one time.

monster.spells: detect magic, disguise self, mage armor, fear, hold person, misty step

monster.name: Dread Warrior
monster.type: undead, Tales from the Yawning Portal

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Tales from the Yawning Portal, page 233

trait.name: Undead Nature
trait.text: A dread warrior doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
trait.text: If damage reduces the dread warrior to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken , unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the dread warrior drops to l hit point instead.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The dread warrior makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Battleaxe
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) slashing damage, or 7 (1d10 + 2) slashing damage if wielded with two hands.

action.name: Javelin
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

monster.name: Duergar Spy
monster.type: humanoid (dwarf), Tales from the Yawning Portal
monster.skill: Deception +5, Insight +2, Investigation +5, Perception +4, Persuasion +3, Sleight of Hand +5, Stealth +7

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Tales from the Yawning Portal, page 234

trait.name: Cunning Action
trait.text: On each of its turns, the spy can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

trait.name: Duergar Resilience
trait.text: The spy has advantage on saving throws against poison, spells, and illusions, as well as to resist being charmed or paralyzed.

trait.name: Sneak Attack
trait.text: Once per turn, the spy can deal an extra 7 (2d6) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the spy that isn't incapacitated and the spy doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the spy has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The spy makes two shortsword attacks.

action.name: Eniarge (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
action.text: For 1 minute, the spy magically increases in size, along with anything it is wearing or carrying. While enlarged, the spy is Large, doubles her damage dice on Strength-based weapon attacks (included in the attacks), and makes Strength checks and Strength saving throws with advantage. If the spy lacks the room to become Large, it attains the maximum size possible in the space available.

action.name: Shortsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage, or 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage while enlarged.

action.name: Hand Crossbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 30/120 ft ., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

action.name: Invisibility (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
action.text: The spy magically turns invisible until it attacks, deals damage, casts a spell, or uses its Enlarge, or until its concentration is broken, up to 1 hour (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the spy wears or carries is invisible with it.

monster.name: Giant Crayfish
monster.type: beast, Tales from the Yawning Portal

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Tales from the Yawning Portal, page 235

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: The giant crayfish can breathe air and water.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The giant crayfish makes two claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1dl0 + 2) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 12). The crayfish has two claws, each of which can grapple only one target.

monster.name: Giant Lightning Eel
monster.type: beast, Tales from the Yawning Portal

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Tales from the Yawning Portal, page 236

trait.name: Water Breathing
trait.text: The eel can breathe only underwater.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The eel makes two bite attacks.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) lightning damage.

action.name: Lightning jolt (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: One creature the eel touches within 5 feet of it outside water, or each creature within l 5 feet ofit in a body of water, must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw. On failed save, a target takes 13 (3d8) lightning damage. If the target takes any of this damage, the target is stunned until the end of the eel's next turn. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage and isn't stunned.

monster.name: Giant Subterranean Lizard
monster.type: beast, Tales from the Yawning Portal

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Tales from the Yawning Portal, page 236

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The lizard makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail. One attack can be replaced by Swallow.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 15). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the lizard can't bite another target.

action.name: Tail
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target not grappled by the lizard. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC l 5 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

action.name: Swallow
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one Medium or smaller creature the lizard is grappling. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) piercing damage, the target is swallowed, and the grapp le ends. The swallowed target is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the lizard, and it takes 10 (3d6) acid damage at the start of each of the lizard's turns. The lizard can have only one target swallowed at a time.
If the lizard dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse using 10 feet of movement, exiting prone.

monster.name: Greater Zombie
monster.type: undead, Tales from the Yawning Portal
monster.languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Tales from the Yawning Portal, page 237

trait.name: Undead Nature
trait.text: A zombie doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Turn Resistance
trait.text: The zombie has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
trait.text: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The zombie makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Empowered Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage and 7 (2d6) necrotic damage.

monster.name: Kalka-Kylla
monster.type: monstrosity, Tales from the Yawning Portal

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Tales from the Yawning Portal, page 238

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: Kalka-Kylla can breathe air and water.

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: While Kalka-Kylla remains motionless and hidden in its shell, it is indistinguishable from a polished boulder.

trait.name: Shell
trait.text: Kalka-Kylla can use a bonus action to retract into or emerge from its shell. While retracted, Kalka-Kylla gains a +4 bonus to AC, and it has a speed of 0 and can't benefit from bonuses to speed.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Kalka-Kylla makes two claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape DC 13). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained. Kalka-Kylla has two claws, each of which can grapple only one target.

monster.name: Kelpie
monster.type: plant, Tales from the Yawning Portal

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Tales from the Yawning Portal, page 238

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: The kelpie can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Seaweed Shape
trait.text: The kelpie can use its action to reshape its body into the form of a humanoid or beast that is Small, Medium, or Large. Its statistics are otherwise unchanged. The disguise is convincing, unless the kelpie is in bright light or the viewer is within 30 feet of it, in which case the seams between the seaweed strands are visible. The kelpie returns to its true form if takes a bonus action to do so or if it dies.

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: While the kelpie remains motionless in its true form, it is indistinguishable from normal seaweed.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The kelpie makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d8 + 2) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape DC 12).

action.name: Drowning Hypnosis
action.text: The kelpie chooses one humanoid it can see within 150 feet of it. If the target can see the kelpie, the target must succeed on a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw or be magically charmed while the kelpie maintains concentration, up to 10 minutes (as if concentrating on a spell).
The charmed target is incapacitated, and instead of holding its breath underwater, it tries to breathe normally and immediately runs out of breath, unless it can breathe water.

If the charmed target is more than 5 feet away from the kelpie, the target must move on its turn toward the kelpie by the most direct route, trying to get within 5 feet. It doesn't avoid opportunity attacks.

Before moving into damaging terrain, such as lava or a pit, and whenever it takes damage from a source other than the kelpie or drowning, the target can repeat the saving throw. A charmed target can also repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If the saving throw is successful, the effect ends on it.
A target that successfully saves is immune to this kelpie's hypnosis for the next 24 hours.

monster.name: Malformed Kraken
monster.type: monstrosity, Tales from the Yawning Portal
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
monster.languages: understands Common but can't speak; telepathy 60 ft.

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Tales from the Yawning Portal, page 239

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: The kraken can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Siege Monster
trait.text: The kraken deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The kraken makes three tentacle attacks. One of them can be replaced with a bite attack, and any of them can be replaced with Fling.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d8 + 7) piercing damage.

action.name: Tentacle
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d6 + 7) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 16). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained. The kraken has ten tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

action.name: Fling
action.text: One Medium or smaller object held or creature grappled by the kraken's tentacles is thrown up to 60 feet in a random direction and knocked prone. If a thrown target strikes a solid surface, the target takes 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked prone.

action.name: Lightning Storm
action.text: The kraken creates three bolts of lightning, each of which can strike a target the kraken can see within 150 feet ofit. A target must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw, taking 16 (3dl0) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.name: Nereid
monster.type: fey, Tales from the Yawning Portal

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Tales from the Yawning Portal, page 240

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: The nereid can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Aquatic Invisibility
trait.text: If immersed in water, the nereid can make itself invisible as a bonus action. It remains invisible until it leaves the water, ends the invisibility as a bonus action, or dies.

trait.name: Mantle Dependent
trait.text: The nereid wears a mantle of silky cloth the color of sea foam, which holds the creature's spirit. The mantle has an AC and hit points equal to that of the nereid, but the garment can't be directly harmed while the nereid wears it. If the mantle is destroyed, the nereid becomes poisoned and dies within 1 hour. A nereid is willing to do anything in its power to recover the mantle if it is stolen, including serving the thief.

trait.name: Shape Water
trait.text: The nereid can cast control water at will, requiring no components. Its spellcasting ability for it is Charisma. This use of the spell has a range of 30 feet and can affect a cube of water no larger than 30 feet on a side.

trait.name: Speak with Animals
trait.text: The nereid can comprehend and verbally communicate with beasts.

action.name: Blinding Acid
action.text: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d12 + 3) acid damage, and the target is blinded until the start of the nereid's next turn.

action.name: Drowning Kiss (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The nereid touches one creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or take 22 (3d12 + 3) acid damage. On a failure, it also runs out of breath and can't speak for 1 minute. At the end of each of its turns, it can repeat the save, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Water Lash
action.text: The nereid causes a 5-foot cube of water within 60 feet of it to take a shape of its choice and strike one target it can see within 5 feet of that water. The target must make a DC 13 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, it takes 17 (4d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage, and ifit is a Large or smaller creature, it is pushed up to 15 feet in a straight line or is knocked prone (nereid's choice). On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and isn't pushed or knocked prone.

monster.name: Ooze Master
monster.type: undead, Tales from the Yawning Portal
monster.resist: lightning, necrotic; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
monster.conditionImmune: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, poisoned, prone

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Tales from the Yawning Portal, page 241

trait.name: Undead Nature
trait.text: The ooze master doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Corrosive Form
trait.text: A creature that touches the Ooze Master or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 9 (2d8) acid damage. Any nonmagical weapon that hits the Ooze Master corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to -5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition that hits the Ooze Master is destroyed after dealing damage.
The Ooze Master can eat through 2-inch-thick, nonmagical wood or metal in 1 round.

trait.name: Instinctive Attack
trait.text: When the Ooze Master casts a spell with a casting time of 1 action, it can make one pseudopod attack as a bonus action.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: The Ooze Master is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following wizard spells prepared:
Cantrips (at will): acid splash, friends, mage hand, poison spray
1st level (4 slots): charm person, detect magic, magic missile, ray of sickness
2nd level (3 slots): detect thoughts, Melf's acid arrow, suggestion
3rd level (3 slots):fear, slow, stinking cloud
4th level (3 slots): confusion, Evard's evard's black tentacles
5th level (1 slot): cloudkill.

trait.name: Spider Climb
trait.text: The Ooze Master can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Pseudopod
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (3d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) acid damage.

reaction.name: Instinctive Charm
reaction.text: If a creature the Ooze Master can see makes an attack roll against it while within 30 feet of it, the Ooze Master can use a reaction to divert the attack if another creature is within the attack's range. The attacker must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the attacker targets the creature that is closest to it, not including itself or the Ooze Master. If multiple creatures are closest, the attacker chooses which one to target. On a successful save, the attacker is immune to this Instinctive Charm for 24 hours. Creatures that can't be charmed are immune to this effect.

monster.spells: acid splash, friends, mage hand, poison spray, charm person, detect magic, magic missile, ray of sickness, detect thoughts, Melf's acid arrow, suggestion,fear, slow, stinking cloud, confusion, Evard's black tentacles, cloudkill

monster.name: Sea Lion
monster.type: monstrosity, Tales from the Yawning Portal

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Tales from the Yawning Portal, page 242

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: The sea lion can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Keen Smell
trait.text: The sea lion has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: The sea lion has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the sea lion's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

trait.name: Swimming Leap
trait.text: With a 10-foot swimming start, the sea lion can long jump out of or across the water up to 25 feet.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The sea lion makes three attacks: one bite attack and two claw attacks.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) piercing damage

monster.name: Sharwyn Hucrele
monster.type: humanoid (human), Tales from the Yawning Portal

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Tales from the Yawning Portal, page 242

trait.name: Barkskin
trait.text: Sharwyn's AC can't be lower than 16.

trait.name: Special Equipment
trait.text: Sharwyn has a spell book that contains the spells listed in her Spellcasting trait, plus detect magic and silent image.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: Sharwyn is a 1st-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). She has the following wizard spells prepared:
Cantrips (at will): light, prestidigitation, ray of frost
1st level (2 slots): color spray, magic missile, shield, sleep.

trait.name: Tree Thrall
trait.text: If the Gulthias Tree dies, Sharwyn dies 24 hours later.

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

monster.spells: light, prestidigitation, ray of frost, color spray, magic missile, shield, sleep

monster.name: Sir Braford
monster.type: humanoid (human), Tales from the Yawning Portal

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Tales from the Yawning Portal, page 243

trait.name: Barkskin
trait.text: Sir Braford's AC can't be lower than 16.

trait.name: Special Equipment
trait.text: Sir Braford wields Shatterspike, a magic longsword that grants a + 1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it (included in his attack). See appendix B for the item's other properties.

trait.name: Tree Thrall
trait.text: If the Gulthias Tree dies, Sir Braford dies 24 hours later.

action.name: Longsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage, or 9 (1dlO + 4) slashing damage if used with two hands.

reaction.name: Protection
reaction.text: When a creature Sir Braford can see attacks a target other than him that is within 5 feet of him, he can use a reaction to use his shield to impose disadvantage on the attack roll.

monster.name: Siren
monster.type: fey, Tales from the Yawning Portal

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Tales from the Yawning Portal, page 243

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: Siren can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: Siren's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 13). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
1/day each: charm person, fog cloud, greater invisibility, polymorph (self only).

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: Siren has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Shortsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

action.name: Stupefying Touch
action.text: Siren touches one creature she can see within 5 feet of her. The creature must succeed on a DC 13 Intelligence saving throw or take 13 (3d6 + 3) psychic damage and be stunned until the start of Siren's next turn.

monster.spells: charm person, fog cloud, greater invisibility, polymorph

monster.name: Tarul Var
monster.type: undead, Tales from the Yawning Portal
monster.resist: cold, lightning, necrotic; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Tales from the Yawning Portal, page 244

trait.name: Undead Nature
trait.text: A lich doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Focused Conjuration
trait.text: While Var is concentrating on a conjuration spell, his concentration can't be broken as a result of taking damage.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If Var fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead .

trait.name: Rejuvenation
trait.text: If Var is destroyed but his phylactery remains intact, Var gains a new body in ldlO days, regaining all his hit points and becoming active again. The new body appears within 5 feet of the phylactery.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: Var is a 12th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 17, +9 to hit with spell attacks). He has the following wizard spells prepared:
Cantrips (at will):.fire bolt, mage hand, minor illusion, prestidigitation, ray of frost
1st level (4 slots): detect magic, magic missile, shield, unseen servant*
2nd level (3 slots): detect thoughts, flaming sphere,* mirror image, scorching ray
3rd level (3 slots): counterspell, dispel magic, fireball
4th level (3 slots): dimension door,* Evard's black tentacles*
5th level (3 slots): cloudkill,* scrying
6th level (1 slot): circle of death
*Conjuration spell of 1st level or higher.

trait.name: Turn Resistance
trait.text: Var has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead .

action.name: Paralyzing Touch
action.text: Melee Spell Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 10 (3d6) cold damage. The target must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Benign Transposition
action.text: Var teleports up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space he can see. Alternatively, he can choose a space within range that is occupied by a Small or Medium creature. If that creature is willing, both creatures teleport, swapping places. Var can use this feature again only after he finishes a long rest or casts a conjuration spell of 1st level or higher.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (3/Turn)
legendary.text: Var can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Var regains spent legendary actions at the start of his turn.

legendary.name: Frightening Gaze (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: Var fixes his gaze on one creature he can see within 10 feet of him . The target must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw against this magic or become frightened for 1 minute. The frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to Var's gaze for the next 24 hours.

monster.spells: fire bolt, mage hand, minor illusion, prestidigitation, ray of frost, detect magic, magic missile, shield, unseen servant, detect thoughts, flaming sphere, mirror image, scorching ray, counterspell, dispel magic, fireball, dimension door, Evard's black tentacles, cloudkill, scrying, circle of death

monster.name: Thayan Warrior
monster.type: humanoid (human), Tales from the Yawning Portal

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Tales from the Yawning Portal, page 246

trait.name: Doomvault Devotion
trait.text: Within the Doomvault, the warrior has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened .

trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: The warrior has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the warrior's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The warrior makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Longsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage, or 8 (1dlO + 3) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Javelin
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

monster.name: Thorn Slinger
monster.type: plant, Tales from the Yawning Portal

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Tales from the Yawning Portal, page 246

trait.name: Adhesive Blossoms
trait.text: The thorn slinger adheres to anything that touches it. A Medium or smaller creature adhered to the thorn slinger is also grappled by it (escape DC 11). Ability checks made to escape this grapple have disadvantage.
At the end of each of the thorn slinger's turns, anything grappled by it takes 3 (1d6) acid damage.

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: While the thorn slinger remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an inanimate bush.

action.name: Thorns
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (2d6 + 1) piercing damage.

monster.name: Vampiric Mist
monster.type: undead, Tales from the Yawning Portal
monster.resist: acid, cold, lightning, necrotic, thunder; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Tales from the Yawning Portal, page 247

trait.name: Undead Nature
trait.text: A vampiric mist doesn't require air or sleep.

trait.name: Blood Sense
trait.text: The vampiric mist can sense living creatures that have blood or similar vital fluids in a radius of 60 feet .

trait.name: Forbiddance
trait.text: The vampiric mist can 't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants.

trait.name: Misty Form
trait.text: The vampiric mist can occupy another creature's space and vice versa. In addition, if air can pass through a space, the mist can pass through it without squeezing. Each foot of movement in water costs it 2 extra feet, rather than l extra foot. The mist can 't manipulate objects in any way that requires hands; it can apply simple force only.

trait.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
trait.text: The vampiric mist takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, the mist has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

action.name: Blood Drain
action.text: One creature in the vampiric mist's space must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw (undead and constructs automatically succeed). On a failed save, the target takes 10 (2d6 + 3) necrotic damage, its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the mist regains hit points equal to that amount.
This reduction to the target's hit point maximum lasts until the target finishes a long rest. It dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

monster.name: White Maw
monster.type: ooze, Tales from the Yawning Portal
monster.conditionImmune: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, poisoned, prone

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Tales from the Yawning Portal, page 248

trait.name: Ooze Nature
trait.text: White Maw doesn't require sleep.

trait.name: Amorphous Form
trait.text: White Maw can occupy another creature's space and vice versa.

trait.name: Corrode Metal
trait.text: Any nonmagical weapon made of metal that hits White Maw corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to -5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition made of metal that hits White Maw is destroyed after dealing damage.
White Maw can eat through 2-inch-thick, nonmagical metal in 1 round.

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: While White Maw remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from white stone.

trait.name: Killer Response
trait.text: Any creature that starts its turn in White Maw's space is targeted by a pseudopod attack if White Maw isn't incapacitated.

action.name: Pseudopod
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (4d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 9 (2d8) acid damage. If the target is wearing nonmagical metal armor, its armor is partly corroded and takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to the AC it offers. The armor is destroyed if the penalty reduces its AC to 10.

monster.name: Yusdrayl
monster.type: humanoid (kobold), Tales from the Yawning Portal

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Tales from the Yawning Portal, page 248

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: Yusdrayl is a 2nd-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). She knows the following sorcerer spells:
Cantrips (at will): mage hand, prestidigitation, ray of frost, shocking grasp
1st level (4 slots): burning hands, chromatic orb, mage armor

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, Yusdrayl has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: Yusdrayl has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of her allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

monster.spells: mage hand, prestidigitation, ray of frost, shocking grasp, burning hands, chromatic orb, mage armor
